result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dazion K Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Dazion K Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Dazion K Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability.Defense requests a status conference date. Court will allow transfer of this case if there's a global resolution with pending cases 22CF2804, 22CF61 . Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Dazion K Hamilton in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dazion K Hamilton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dazion K Hamilton not in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/06/2022@2:00pm
